mount-mansfield-region.title: Mount Mansfield Region
mount-mansfield-region.subtitle: The Green Mountains From the Winooski to the Lamoille River
mount-mansfield-region.description: High resolution elevation map of the Mount Mansfield region from the Winooski to the Lamoille.
body: This section of the Green Mountains is home to the highest mountain in Vermont, Mount Mansfield. It is also my home range, with the western edge only 30 minutes from where I live in Burlington, Vermont.

Within are three ski resorts and numerous backcountry zones both well known and little explored. Mount Mansfield is home to the largest alpine zone in the state and many of the peaks and drainages in the area offer some of the best tree skiing around.

stowe.title: Stowe
stowe.subtitle: Vermont's Largest Alpine Zone
stowe.description: High resolution elevation map of Stowe Mountain Resort, on the eastern side of Mount Mansfield
body: The eastern side of Vermont's highest peak is home to Stowe Mountain Resort. Stowe's inbounds terrain is among the best in Vermont and it's lifts provide access to some of the gnarliest alpine skiing in the northeast.

smugglers-notch.title: Smuggs
smugglers-notch.subtitle: Slow Lifts and Epic Sidecountry
smugglers-notch.description: High resolution elevation map of Smugglers Notch Resort

bolton-valley.title: Bolton Valley
bolton-valley.description: High resolution elevation map of Bolton Valley Resort
body: This map shows Bolton lit up by the early spring sun. Late in the season Bolton shines when its west-facing slopes catch the late afternoon sun and you can finish your day skiing into the sunset with Lake Champlain and the Adirondacks laid out before you.

bolton-to-trapps.title: Bolton to Trapps
bolton-to-trapps.subtitle: Section 22 of the Catamount Trail
bolton-to-trapps.description: High resolution elevation map of Bolton to Trapps, section 22 of the catamount trail
body: The Catamount Trail stretches the entire length of the state of Vermont, winding its way along the sping of the Green Mountains. The trail reaches its highest point along the Bolton to Trapps trail, which is also one of its more famous sections.
The tour starts at the Bolton Valley Nordic Center and ends at Trapp Family Lodge. A nordic pass is required from both resorts.

jay-peak.title: Jay Peak
jay-peak.subtitle: Vermont's Snowiest Resort
jay-peak.description: High resolution elevation map of Jay Peak Resort and surroundings.

killington.title: Killington
killington.subtitle: Vermont's Longest Ski Season
killington.description: High resolution elevation map of Killington Ski Resort

camels-hump.subtitle: Vermont's Highest Undeveloped Peak
camels-hump.description: High resolution elevation map of Camel's Hump
